candidates.name: John Rose
highlights: $5M personal loan — largest self-funding in the race
92% of donations from Tennessee — core campaign talking point
First candidate on TV with statewide ad buys

candidates.name: Marsha Blackburn
highlights: 33,000 contributions — briefly crashed state filing system
78% of money from out-of-state donors — Rose's key attack line
$5.35M raised without self-funding — biggest pure fundraising total

candidates.name: Monty Fritts
highlights: Minimal fundraising — relies on grassroots events

analysis: The money race reveals two fundamentally different Republican strategies. Rose bet big on himself — a $5M personal loan plus $1.46M raised, all while keeping 92% of his donors in-state. Blackburn countered with sheer volume: 33,000 contributions totaling $5.35M, leveraging her national Senate donor network. Rose is hammering her 78% out-of-state rate in ads; Blackburn argues the volume shows grassroots enthusiasm. On the Democratic side, fundraising reflects the party's structural disadvantage in Tennessee statewide races — Green leads with $285K, a fraction of either Republican's total.
